title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned for indicating that the ammeter is M2

One point is earned for indicating that the voltmeter is M1
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for indicating that the ammeter is M2

One point is earned for indicating that the voltmeter is M1

The student earns one of the following points:

One point is earned for indicating that the ammeter is M2

One point is earned for indicating that the voltmeter is M1

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for indicating that the ammeter is M2

One point is earned for indicating that the voltmeter is M1

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned for correctly plotting all 4 points.

One point is earned for correct straight line based on the points that were plotted
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly plotting all 4 points.

One point is earned for correct straight line based on the points that were plotted

The student earns one of the following points:

One point is earned for correct straight line based on the points that were plotted

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for correctly plotting all 4 points.

One point is earned for correct straight line based on the points that were plotted

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned for any indication of Δy Δx  or  Δ K max Δf  or  y x  or  K max f

One point is earned for a value of h consistent with the plotted data
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for any indication of Δy Δx  or  Δ K max Δf  or  y x  or  K max f

One point is earned for a value of h consistent with the plotted data

The student earns one of the following points:

One point is earned for any indication of Δy Δx  or  Δ K max Δf  or  y x  or  K max f

One point is earned for a value of h consistent with the plotted data

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for any indication of Δy Δx  or  Δ K max Δf  or  y x  or  K max f

One point is earned for a value of h consistent with the plotted data

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Two points for a statement that the graph moves to the right or down, OR for a sketch of a second parallel line to the right of the first graph and labeled as the second graph

Two points for a correct explanation that relates to a graph or to the physical situation, such as one of the following:

A larger work function means a larger y-intercept (no penalty for not including a minus sign before the y-intercept).

A larger work function means a larger x-intercept or threshold frequency.

A larger work function means that greater energy is needed in order for an electron to escape from the surface
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

Two points for a statement that the graph moves to the right or down, OR for a sketch of a second parallel line to the right of the first graph and labeled as the second graph

Two points for a correct explanation that relates to a graph or to the physical situation, such as one of the following:

A larger work function means a larger y-intercept (no penalty for not including a minus sign before the y-intercept).

A larger work function means a larger x-intercept or threshold frequency.

A larger work function means that greater energy is needed in order for an electron to escape from the surface

The student earns one of the following points:

Two points for a statement that the graph moves to the right or down, OR for a sketch of a second parallel line to the right of the first graph and labeled as the second graph

Two points for a correct explanation that relates to a graph or to the physical situation, such as one of the following:

A larger work function means a larger y-intercept (no penalty for not including a minus sign before the y-intercept).

A larger work function means a larger x-intercept or threshold frequency.

A larger work function means that greater energy is needed in order for an electron to escape from the surface

The student earns two of the following points:

Two points for a statement that the graph moves to the right or down, OR for a sketch of a second parallel line to the right of the first graph and labeled as the second graph

Two points for a correct explanation that relates to a graph or to the physical situation, such as one of the following:

A larger work function means a larger y-intercept (no penalty for not including a minus sign before the y-intercept).

A larger work function means a larger x-intercept or threshold frequency.

A larger work function means that greater energy is needed in order for an electron to escape from the surface

The student earns three of the following points:

Two points for a statement that the graph moves to the right or down, OR for a sketch of a second parallel line to the right of the first graph and labeled as the second graph

Two points for a correct explanation that relates to a graph or to the physical situation, such as one of the following:

A larger work function means a larger y-intercept (no penalty for not including a minus sign before the y-intercept).

A larger work function means a larger x-intercept or threshold frequency.

A larger work function means that greater energy is needed in order for an electron to escape from the surface

The student earns all of the following points:

Two points for a statement that the graph moves to the right or down, OR for a sketch of a second parallel line to the right of the first graph and labeled as the second graph

Two points for a correct explanation that relates to a graph or to the physical situation, such as one of the following:

A larger work function means a larger y-intercept (no penalty for not including a minus sign before the y-intercept).

A larger work function means a larger x-intercept or threshold frequency.

A larger work function means that greater energy is needed in order for an electron to escape from the surface
